perturbation.original_text:
Wherever used in this Agreement with initial terms capitalized, the
following terms shall have the following defined meanings:
      "CO-BRANDED PAGES" means pages of the Snap Web Site, to be developed
pursuant to Section 2.2  [CO-BRANDED PAGES] and hosted on the Snap Web Site, that display both the
Snap Brand Features and the Sponsor Brand Features, along with such Sponsor
Content, Snap Content and other content as the parties may agree upon.
perturbation.changed_text:
Wherever used in this Agreement with initial terms capitalized, the
following terms shall have the following defined meanings:
      "CO-BRANDED PAGES" means pages of the Snap Web Site, to be developed
pursuant to Section 2.2  [CO-BRANDED PAGES] and hosted on the Snap Web Site, that display the
Snap Brand Features, but may or may not display the Sponsor Brand Features. The inclusion of Sponsor Brand Features is subject to Snap's sole discretion, along with such Sponsor
Content, Snap Content and other content as the parties may agree upon.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition mandates that Co-Branded Pages display both Snap and Sponsor Brand Features. The modified definition makes the display of Sponsor Brand Features discretionary, controlled solely by Snap, which contradicts the idea of co-branding and potentially disadvantages the Sponsor.

perturbation.original_text:
During the Term, and for a period of five (5) years
thereafter, the receiving party will not disclose to others or use for any
purpose of its own, other than in performance of this Agreement, any
Confidential Information of the other party. Each party shall take, at a
minimum, measures consistent with those taken to protect its own similar types
of Confidential Information (and in any event, at least reasonable measures) to
protect the other's Confidential Information against disclosures prohibited by
this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
During the Term, and for a period of one (1) year
thereafter, the receiving party will not disclose to others or use for any
purpose of its own, other than in performance of this Agreement, any
Confidential Information of the other party. Each party shall take what they deem to be the minimum, measures consistent with those taken to protect its own similar types
of Confidential Information to protect the other's Confidential Information against disclosures prohibited by
this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text establishes a 5-year confidentiality period and 'at least reasonable measures' of protection. The modification shortens the period to 1 year and gives each party discretion over the measures taken, creating uncertainty about the actual level of protection and contradicting the original intent of a stricter confidentiality agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
Either party may terminate the Term upon not less
than sixty (60) days prior written notice to the other party of any breach
hereof by such other party. In addition, either party may terminate the Term
immediately upon written notice in the event that the other party shall fail
to do business in the normal course or become subject to any bankruptcy,
assignment for creditors, corporate dissolution or similar proceeding.
perturbation.changed_text:
Either party may terminate the Term upon not less
than thirty (30) days prior written notice to the other party of any breach
hereof by such other party. In addition, Snap may terminate the Term
immediately upon oral notice in the event that United Airlines shall fail
to meet Snap's expectations for user data collection or new partnership opportunities.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates a 60-day written notice for breach-related terminations and outlines specific conditions for immediate termination. The modification allows Snap to terminate immediately with only oral notice based on subjective 'expectations' related to user data or opportunities, giving Snap more flexibility and contradicting the earlier specific terms.
